events.title: Elizabeth I crowned Queen of England
events.description: Elizabeth I was crowned queen at Westminster Abbey, marking the formal beginning of her long reign and the Elizabethan era after the death of her sister, Mary I.
events.significance: Solidified the Tudor dynasty and set the stage for a period of relative stability and cultural flowering in England.

events.title: The British Museum opens to the public
events.description: The British Museum in London opens its doors as a national public museum, offering access to its vast collections.
events.significance: Pioneered the model of a public, publicly funded museum and expanded access to knowledge about world history.

events.title: First Super Bowl played
events.description: The Green Bay Packers defeated the Kansas City Chiefs 35–10 in the first AFL–NFL World Championship Game, held at the Los Angeles Memorial Coliseum.
events.significance: Launched the NFL's championship game into a global entertainment phenomenon and began a long-running sports tradition.

events.title: Wikipedia launches
events.description: Wikipedia, a free, collaborative online encyclopedia, is launched and quickly grows into a major source of information.
events.significance: Revolutionized how knowledge is created, edited, and consumed on the internet.

events.title: Miracle on the Hudson
events.description: US Airways Flight 1549, piloted by Captain Chesley Sullenberger, ditched in the Hudson River after a bird strike; all 155 people aboard survived.
events.significance: Displayed exceptional piloting and crisis management, becoming a symbol of effective emergency response.
